title: Quiet Storm Vol. 2
description:
From the back of the Quiet Storm Vol. 1 & Vol. 2 double VHS set (pictured above), written specifically about Vol. 2:

The battle between the North and South rages on, but there’s nothing civil about this war. We’re referring to the combat style competition between Northern and Southern California skateboarders that’s been going on for years.

See the San Francisco urban guerillas charge forward with their gritty hit & run street freestyle maneuvers, while the San Diego troops rule the ramps with outrageous aerial stunts. And neither side takes prisoners!

soundtracks.track: Lil Louis & The World - Do U Luv Me
Mad Mike, Underground Resistance - The Illuminator

title: Quiet Storm Vol. 1
description:
From the back of the Quiet Storm Vol. 1 & Vol. 2 double VHS set, written specifically about Vol. 1:

San Francisco, San Diego, Hawaii—from the laid-back East to the frenetic Western Front, the vibe may be different but the spirit of competition is just as fierce. 

Grab your skateboard and follow the skate world’s biggest stars as they take their extraordinary talents to new heights. See street skaters and NSA professionals from all across the country do battle for top honors. 

Catch Chris Miller’s killer ramp to ramp transfer and much more as this group of unconventional athletes martial their forces and blow the lid off the joint in Quiet Storm. The forecast is humid, hot ’n heavy.

soundtracks.track: Spermbirds - No Punks In K Town
Matt Markus - Jake Kee The Duck

title: Xola 955
description:
"New one from Mexico passed on by our boy Felipe Bartolome featuring – as he put it – ‘a group of youngsters coming in pretty hot’ lol. Don’t have any full names (first names listed in the yt description) but recognised Jake Church and Nico Gisonno in the mix… Either way a lot of wild shit in there so definitely worth your time. Plus it includes the first recorded sighting of a rail been waxed with lip balm."

-Arthur, Free Skate Mag

soundtracks.track: Modest Mouse - Night On The Sun
7038634357 - No Hate Is A Cold Star

title: Lakai - EMB Carroll
description:
From the backside of the DVD sleeve: "I don't really remember the first time I met Michael Sean Carroll or even the first time I went to Embarcadero. If I had to guess, It would have been around 1989 or 1990. I would have just turned 16 and gotten my driver's license then, which allowed me to go to San Francisco and back without public transit.

I do however remember driving up Highway 280 from Palo Alto to Daly City and cruising through the morning fog that surrounded Mike's House. I would get to his house and wait on the couch for Mike to get ready, then we'd head into the city. We'd often stop at FTC then go straight to EMB, find a parking spot and skate all day.

When Mike and I first started filming, it was never for a specific video, it was always just to film his new tricks. When Mike Ternasky made the migration from H-Street to Plan B, I became the logical filmer dedicated to Mike Carroll. From Airplanes to Canada and road trips to San Diego and back, the nostalgia from those times with Mike always goes back to EMB. The loud bricks and solid cement blocks created the ultimate testing ground for tricks that defined the future of skateboarding.

In hindsight, I have grow to view it as a privilege to be associated with that era and to have spent so much time documenting a place that now only exists in our memories. This shoe and video are time capsules of that era and a snapshot of what passed before the lens of my camera." 

-Jacob Rosenberg, March 2007

soundtracks.track: Del the Funky Homosapien feat. Hieroglyphics - Burnt

title: Translations
description: "After a year of filming skateboarding in various countries such as China, Spain, Netherlands, Germany, Malaysia, France, Korea, Thailand, Sweden, Singapore, United States, Poland, Hong Kong, Morocco and even Vietnam, Translations has been finally completed. It was not an easy talk to film skateboarding in unexplored environments and foreign cultures. Dealing with sketchy police officers in Morocco, food poisoning in Asia, searching for skateboarding spots on mopeds in Vietnam, was part of our everyday challenges while shooting for Translations."

title: Adidas - Adimatic by Jamal Smith
description:
Jamal Smith puts his rendition of the Adimatic to the test.

Co-designed by Jamal Smith, the late 90's classic Adimatic silhouette is revived, drawing inspiration from hip-hop production, sample loops, and his personal affinity for doing tricks involving 360 spins.
